concept.title: Using Studio to Connect Your Social Apps to Your Livefyre Implementation
concept.shortdesc: To enable a social login, use Studio to add your social apps’ credentials to your Livefyre integration, and customize the Login Modal.

section.title: Customizing the Login Modal
section.p: The Login Modal allows you to customize the information your users will see when logging into your apps. You can customize the modal window.

ul.li: Logo: Upload a logo for use in your login modals.
Font Family: Select a font to match your branding.
Brand Color: Enter a hex color to be used for specific text within the modal.
Terms & Conditions URL: Enter the URL for your company’s Terms and Conditions page. This field is required for use with Livefyre Identity.

section.title: Translating Livefyre Identity
section.p: You can create and modify translation sets for text strings in Livefyre Identity.
See Translation Sets for more on using translation sets with Livefyre Identity.
See Livefyre Identity for more on the specific strings you can customize for Livefyre Identity.

section.title: Enable Login with Email
section.p: Allow users to use their email addresses to log in and interact with Apps on your site.
To enable login using a Livefyre native account:

ol.li: Navigate to Integration Settings in Livefyre Studio.
Switch the Enable Login with Email toggle to On.

section.title: Enable Login Using a Facebook Account
section.p: Connect your Facebook account to Livefyre to allow users to use their Facebook logins to interact with Apps on your site.
To enable login using a Facebook account:

ol.li: Switch the Enable Login with Facebook toggle to ON.

li.p: Add your Facebook app’s App ID and App Secret.
These values are listed in your Facebook developers dashboard for the app, available from https://developers.facebook.com/apps/.

section.title: Enable Login with Google
section.p: Connect your Google+ account to Livefyre to allow users to use their Google+ logins to interact with Apps on your site.
To enable login using a Google+ account:

ol.li: Switch the Enable Login with Google toggle to ON.

li.p: Add your Google app’s Client ID and Client secret.

These values are listed in your Google Cloud Platform project interface, available from https://console.cloud.google.com/. To retrieve this information, go to API Manager > Credentials, and click the project name.

section.title: Enable a Login Using a Twitter Account
section.p: Connect your Twitter account to Livefyre to allow users to use their Twitter logins to interact with Apps on your site.
To enable login using a Twitter account:

ol.li: Switch the Enable Login with Twitter toggle to ON.

li.p: Add your Twitter app’s Consumer Key (API Key) and Consumer Secret (API Secret).
These values are listed in your Twitter app’s Keys and Access Tokens page, available from https://apps.twitter.com/.

section.title: Enable Login Using a Yahoo! Account
section.p: Connect your Yahoo! account to Livefyre to allow users to use their Yahoo! logins to interact with Apps on your site.
To enable login using a Yahoo! account:

ol.li: Switch the Enable Login with Yahoo! toggle to ON.

li.p: Add your Yahoo! app’s Client ID and Client Secret.
These values are listed in the Yahoo! app details page, available from developer.yahoo.com/apps.

section.title: Enable Login Using a Microsoft Live Account
section.p: Connect your Microsoft Live ID account to Livefyre to allow users to use their Microsoft Live ID logins to interact with Apps on your site.
To enable login using a Microsoft Live ID account:

ol.li: In Livefyre > Integration Settings > Livefyre Identity > Microsoft Live, switch the Enable Microsoft Live Login toggle to On.
Enter the Microsoft Live Client ID (Private Key) and Microsoft Live Client Secret (Password).

li.p: The Microsoft Live Client ID (Private Key) and Microsoft Live Client Secret (Password) values are listed in the Microsoft Live ID app details page.

section.title: Connect your Social Apps to Livefyre Identity
section.p: Enable your users to use your Livefyre Identity implementation for apps on your site.

ol.li: Navigate to Studio > Settings > Integration Settings > Livefyre Identity.
Enter the required App credentials for the App you created.
